tweet: Last night was frightening. I thank Gilroy’s law enforcement for their quick action and the Garlic Festival’s staff for the tremendous job they did in the aftermath. My wife and I are ok. We pray for those killed and injured and for their families. pic.twitter.com/arPdHiKAT5

This week I reintroduced the Great Lakes Water Protection Act to improve H20 quality in Great Lakes Basin by ending a practice that results in untreated wastewater being mixed w/ fully-treated water before it is discharged. We must protect the health of #GreatLakes. #cleanwater

Had a great chat w/ @billjcameron about my vote against the budget deal that would $1.7 trillion to our national debt, the disagreement between @Metra & @Amtrak over Union Station lease renewal, upcoming rail reauthorization & more. The show also airs Sunday on @wlsam890 at 7 pm. https://twitter.com/billjcameron/status/1154858470669205505 …

I hosted a Railroad Shippers Roundtable w/Subcommittee on Rail, Pipelines & HazMats & was joined by 2 Chicagoland shippers to discuss the concern of increasing fees imposed by railroads & declining service quality & reliability.  http://bit.ly/2GoX3Fl

Good writeup in @thehill about my & @RepRooney’s carbon fee bills to fight #climatechange. My bill would impose $40 fee per ton of CO2, & use revenue collected to cut payroll tax. Thx to @citizensclimate @WorldResources @nature_wonks @FCNLgreen for support https://thehill.com/policy/energy-environment/454819-carbon-tax-shows-new-signs-of-life-in-congress …

I’m concerned the federal government doesn’t do enough to incentivize basic chemical research that minimizes harm to human health & the environment. I’m proud to introduce #HR2051 w/@RepMoolenaar & thank @RepEBJ for her support & cosponsoring this important piece of legislation.

I voted against budget deal b/c we must find solutions w/out adding $1.7 trillion in debt over next 10 yrs for future generations. @BudgetHawks said this deal may be the worst in US history. We need to thoughtfully structure ways to reduce our debt & not simply throw our hands up pic.twitter.com/yDLXu44qNN

I testified before @EnergyCommerce to encourage committee to take up the #EtO is Toxic Act & provide oversight of @EPA to see if it is taking appropriate action to protect public health from the dangers of EtO. Communities surrounding @Sterigenics1 & elsewhere must be protected! pic.twitter.com/XBkGP03CK3

Today, the House votes to #PassthePASTAct that will end the practice of soring #horses: intentionally inflicting pain to their feet to win prizes. I'm proud to cosponsor H.R. 693 & to vote for it, & call on the Senate to swiftly pass the bill to end this cruelty! @AWAction_News

Happy to report my amendment to #HR3597 passed @HouseScience. Nearly HALF of all calls placed to cell phones this year will be scam calls. That’s why I voted for the #StopBadRobocalls Act on the House floor today to put a stop the onslaught of robocalls once and for all. pic.twitter.com/MLP6ulkDUi

Today I'm voting for the #ButchLewisAct. Without this bill millions of retired workers like electricians, steelworkers & more will lose their earned pension benefits. We should all agree that #pensions must not be cut for retirees already receiving them. It's about basic fairness pic.twitter.com/tTeFa9uVTP

Today the House passed Energy & Water Research Integration Act of 2019. This bill ensures we can meet #energy needs while keeping our H2O clean. I worked on amendment w/ @HouseScience colleagues to support research that minimizes energy industry impacts on groundwater & waterways
I’ll be on the @JohnHowellWLS show at 5:30 CST tonight to talk about my trip to the border last week and other news of the day. Tune in at  http://www.wlsam.com

I signed a new letter to @EPA calling for stricter EtO standards. For several months I've pressed EPA to provide a timeline to review these regulations & introduced #CleanUpEtOAct to ensure that review was conducted. Here's my testimony urging EPA to act to protect public health. pic.twitter.com/2ZIltChYRS

NAFTA 2.0 aka #USMCA deal the president signed locks in #BigPharma policies that saddle Americans w/highest medicine prices in world. POTUS needs to #FixUSMCA & remove these giveaways from deal to help American families struggling w/high cost of Rx drugs https://nym.ag/2I4Bwn1

Our students need to be prepared to meet the challenges of the 21st century. Animal cruelty is unacceptable in our society. We must pass the #PACTAct because it is our responsibility or #ProtectOurPets!

Great to hear that @girlscouts will be adding 12 new, STEM-focused badges for scouts in grades K-12, including badges for cybersecurity and space science. Introducing #STEM at early ages opens doors to new opportunities for women in STEM fields. #girlscouts

Yesterday's vote to repeal the tax on #MiddleClass Health Benefits was made possible through a rules change my Problems Solvers colleagues & I helped enact to get more bipartisan bills to the floor & open up the process to more bottom-up policy making. http://bit.ly/2JRx6is

Tomorrow I'll be joining my colleagues in the bipartisan Problem Solvers Caucus on a trip to our southern border. We'll be inspecting points of entry, a border patrol station, a holding facility & a centralized processing center. We need to find solutions to the #BorderCrisis

I regret having to miss today’s @AmChemistry & @CCSTechFacts briefing on industrial contributions to greenhouse gas emissions. If we develop carbon capture technologies in the U.S., we will establish leadership, grow our economy & push forward in fighting #climatechange.

Congrats to our DC interns Gabriel Flores of Chicago & Matthew Schiltz of La Grange for winning @ILStateSociety scholarships! Gabriel attends @UMich & Matthew attends @IllinoisStateU. #IL03 is proud to have these 2 interns represent the district in DC! pic.twitter.com/SXlY7nJYRI

For the first time in 12 yrs, the House will pass a bill to raise the fed minimum wage. This will benefit 120,000 workers in #IL03 alone. But's it not a cure-all. We must continue to create & protect U.S. jobs through smart trade policies & Buy American initiatives. #RaiseTheWage

If the President is going to be impeached there must be a much stronger case than the one in Rep Green’s resolution. House committees are still investigating and Mueller will be testifying next week. Therefore, I voted to table the impeachment resolution.

Had a productive meeting w/ IL members of the @ShopFloorNAM to discuss the strength of American manufacturing. NAM represents 14,000 member companies in every industrial sector, including several in #IL03. pic.twitter.com/tE8VlCJT5I

The President & ALL public officials have a special responsibility to not use divisive rhetoric that tears our nation apart; we Pledge to be “one Nation under God, indivisible.” But EVERY person also has a moral obligation to not be divisive & to treat everyone with dignity. 3/3

There are always plenty of people willing to take the president to task for his rhetoric, but in the past few days his tweets have been so far out of line of what is acceptable that it is important for all of us in public service to make clear our sharp disapproval. 2/3

I generally ignore the incendiary tweets of @potus & other politicians who are trying to inflame passions & bait opponents. Joining the worthless rhetorical fight is a waste of time that should be spent bringing people together to get things done. That’s my job. 1/3
